5318366:
bronchoscopy note - [REDACTED]

pt [REDACTED] mrn [REDACTED] is a 80yo female here for bronch w EBUS staging and robotic biopsy of a 20.2mm LUL nodule that was solid on CT, bronchus sign was positive, PET showed SUV 16.9.

under general we did linear EBUS first using the Pentax EB-1990i scope with 21g needle and sampled stations 4L x2, 7 x3, 10R x4, ROSE was there and showed Adequate lymphocytes, no malignancy at multiple stations.

then switched to Galaxy robot and navigated to the LUL inferior lingula (B5) lesion, registration was 2.3mm which is fine, got radial EBUS showing concentric view and did tool in lesion confirmation with radial ebus. took 7 forceps bx, 4 needle passes, brushings x2, BAL sent for cultures.

ROSE from the nodule was Malignant - small cell carcinoma.

no bleeding no ptx   patient did well

specimens to path for cyto, surgical path, cell block, flow, molecular if needed

d/c home after recovery with standard precautions, f/u 1-2wks for path

Rachel Goldman md
ip attending
